title: GM Williams optimistic in face of low expectations
subtitle: GM Williams optimistic in face of low expectations
body: CHICAGO -- Sunday's SoxFest conclusion left those attendees at the Palmer House Hilton filled with optimism for the 2012 season as February approaches. Count White Sox general manager Ken Williams among those optimists, one of the many in the organization who hasn't been shaken by low preseason predictions for his team.  "[Prognosticators] picked us [to finish] first for a lot of years and unfortunately, we didn't hold up our end of the bargain," Williams said. "In 2008, they picked us third.  "Where are we now? Third or fourth? Good. They're never right. They're wrong more than me."
